tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids @InvasiveSp You need concentrate on invasive gas, poisoning 1000s of humans every night #stopthestink

We've launched a new roadmap to hit our net zero target by 2030 by reducing our carbon emissions by 45% üåç

Read our plan: https://t.co/AfenQc0C4u

#TogetherForOurPlanet #NetZero https://t.co/pE7ql2Paxe

It‚Äôs #InvasiveSpecies week!
Invasive non-native species reduce the ability of native wildlife to cope with other pressures such as climate change & habitat loss. 
This week we‚Äôll be sharing content about invasive non-native species &what you can do to help 
#INNSweek @InvasiveSp https://t.co/fa8JScmR2U

"As fast as possible" @ClareDinnisEA that is not the case though is it. This has been terrible for yrs but more recently the last 5 have been catastrophic. Our community has complained & begged the @EnvAgency for fresh air for the last 5 yrs My kids health is suffering from this https://t.co/FSVvxWLDuB

Last week was the first of our five vertical lift gate sluice inspections at Colwick Suice on the Trent. Always interesting to examine and learn from the issues different structures face after being in service for some years. @Eadonnews @ECSengineering @EnvAgency https://t.co/4HSqthy4OK

If we were in the USA, their EPA would have advised staying indoors and protecting the elderly and children when the H2S from #WalleysQuarry hit its peak over just ten minutes. I wonder how they'd respond to repeated exposure over months @EnvAgency

tweets.text: @EnvAgencyMids @InvasiveSp What about invasive gasses ? you've done precious little to stop them in North Staffordshire . #redindustries (good friends of The EA) #stopthestink @StinkStopthe

@numenini @GlavenEel @theriverstrust @EnvAgencyAnglia Thankfully, we did some training at Bayfield last week and there were quite a few trout, stickles and a couple of eels, but we'll try to take another look.

@RussellB1ggs @WildTroutTrust @N_Rivers_Trust @EnvAgency @The_WMA @NENorfolkSufflk @AnglianWater @WestNorfolkBC It meandered wider I think at base taking on more of the floodplain, I've an aerial somewhere taken in a very dry summer that have clues but it isn't an easy one to trace.

@numenini @N_Rivers_Trust @theriverstrust @EnvAgencyAnglia Wow, gutted to hear you didnt see any fish. Could have been that the otter had just swim through and murkiness often caused by the mill releasing after grinding flour.

@EnvAgency Clean air my arse ! Tell that to the 30,000 people suffering in North Staffordshire. Your organisation is losing all credibility and is becoming a national joke.

@TeamBen_13 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency The EA have been proven out of date, they need to come out and say their methods of investigation are not in line with the problem we have of intense concentrations of hydrogen sulphide from LFG, also properties being polluted by walls of gas where outside looks clear in the day!

WOW 1350 ug/m3 measured at the Galingale air quality monitor! The WHO human health limit is set to 150 ug/m3! You REALLY are killing us slowly. You did a great job at hiding that PEAK in your official reports! @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @PHE_uk #stopthestink https://t.co/pKpw3uIzxo

@SianieRoo @EnvAgencyMids @AaronBell4NUL @SimonTagg @PHE_uk It‚Äôs all on the EAs website. I didn‚Äôt quite digest how high the readings were until I started to look at the actual raw data set, because technically the health limit is averaged out over a 24 hour period & in the report that‚Äôs how it‚Äôs been presented. Those readings are shocking https://t.co/U6OYp8Z4Wb

urls.title: Emissions effort threatens concrete flood defences
urls.description: Flood-prone communities may miss out on concrete flood defences under plans by the Environment Agency to cut its carbon footprint by focusing on nature-based solutions to flooding.It plans to reduce

tweets.text:
Sad to see nature based solutions being reported as a bad thing. It's great to see the @EnvAgency planning for net zero by 2030 and nature based solutions should be a big part of that 

https://t.co/4W1stSd5EN?

@MrMarkwarren1 @LoneRanger77777 @TeamBen_13 @ClareDinnisEA @EnvAgency As fast as possible !! Is that @EnvAgency definition of fast ? If it is an asthmatic tortoise moves faster than them . Is 6 months after being reported fast ? Sorry but you‚Äôre organisation is pathetic and needs a massive overhaul

I went down for a swim in Plymouth Sound this morning but visible signs of sewage pollution and the confirmation from swimmers meant that I didn't dare! It's 2021, we pay the biggest water bills in the country and we still can't swim in clean water. @EnvAgency @SouthWestWater https://t.co/lQcgaIDyAk
